item.title: Bangladesh’s Ousted Leader Sheikh Hasina Faces New Arrest Warrant
item.description: The war crimes tribunal that Sheikh Hasina herself founded has now charged her in the crackdown that killed more than a thousand demonstrators.

item.title: U.K. to Build Up to 12 Submarines as Part of Shift to ‘War-Fighting Readiness’
item.description: Amid rising global tensions, Prime Minister Keir Starmer outlined rearmament plans aimed at deterring an increasingly hostile Russia.

item.title: Ukraine and Russia to Meet for Second Round of Talks
item.description: After more than three years of war, Russia and Ukraine are engaged in direct and public talks to end the fighting, but their positions remain far apar...

item.title: Poland Elects Karol Nawrocki as President
item.description: The victory of Karol Nawrocki, who is backed by the previous right-wing governing party, will complicate Prime Minister Donald Tusk’s efforts to advan...

item.title: The Imports the U.S. Relies On Most From 140 Nations, From Albania to Zimbabwe
item.description: A look at the item from each country that makes up the largest American import share.
